revised_title: Multiple-nodding Oscillations of a Driven Inverted Pendulum: A New Way to Avoid Falling Over
tldr: The author explores the behavior of a driven inverted pendulum and discovers a new way for it to avoid falling over through multiple-nodding oscillations. These oscillations occur when the pendulum is initially disturbed and can be influenced by factors such as damping and drive frequency. The study also reveals the existence of period-3 double-nodding and period-2 triple-nodding modes, showcasing the complexity of the pendulum's behavior.
